list_variables.description: The IDs of the AWS OpsWorks layers to associate with this instance.
list_variables.name: LayerIds

variables.description: The ID of the custom Amazon Machine Image (AMI) to be used to create the                   instance. The AMI should be based on one of the standard AWS OpsWorks APIs.
variables.name: AmiId

variables.description: For scaling instances, the type of scaling. If you specify load-based scaling,                   do not specify a time-based scaling configuration. For valid values, see CreateInstance in the                      AWS OpsWorks API Reference.
variables.name: AutoScalingType

variables.description: Whether the instance is optimized for Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) I/O. If you specify an                   Amazon EBS-optimized instance type, AWS OpsWorks enables EBS optimization by default. For more                   information, see Amazon EBS-Optimized                      Instances in the Amazon EC2 User Guide for Linux Instances.
variables.name: EbsOptimized

variables.description: Whether to install operating system and package updates when the instance                   boots.
variables.name: InstallUpdatesOnBoot

variables.description: The instance type, which must be supported by AWS OpsWorks. For more information, see                      CreateInstance in the                      AWS OpsWorks API Reference.
variables.name: InstanceType

variables.description: The instance operating system. For more information, see CreateInstance in the                      AWS OpsWorks API Reference.
variables.name: Os

variables.description: The root device type of the instance.
variables.name: RootDeviceType

variables.description: The SSH key name of the instance.
variables.name: SshKeyName

variables.description: The ID of the AWS OpsWorks stack that this instance will be associated with.
variables.name: StackId

variables.description: The ID of the instance's subnet. If the stack is running in a VPC, you can use                   this parameter to override the stack's default subnet ID value and direct AWS OpsWorks to                   launch the instance in a different subnet.
variables.name: SubnetId

variables.description: The time-based scaling configuration for the instance.
variables.name: TimeBasedAutoScaling
